{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Engineering Manager",
  "description": "Olam Agri is a market-leading, differentiated food, feed, and fiber agri-business with a global origination footprint, processing capabilities, and deep understanding of market needs built over 33 years. With a strong presence in high-growth emerging markets and products across grains &amp; oilseeds, animal feed &amp; protein, rice, edible oils, specialty grains &amp; seeds, cotton, wood products, rubber and commodity financial services.

Olam Agri is at the heart of global food and agri-trade flows with more than 40 million MT in volume traded annually. Focused on transforming food, feed and fiber for a more sustainable future, it aims at creating value for customers, enabling farming communities to prosper sustainably, and strive for a food-secure future.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Engineering Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Ilorin, Kwara
Employment Type: Full Time

Job Description


	The Engineering Manager is responsible for overseeing all engineering activities and maintenance practices across the company&#39;s sites.
	The primary goal is to ensure maximum plant availability and operational efficiency.


Responsibilities
Maintenance &amp; Operations:


	Implement and manage best-in-class preventive and predictive maintenance strategies to maximize equipment uptime and plant availability.
	Set and achieve key performance indicator (KPI) targets, including power, steam, and Repair &amp; Maintenance (R&amp;M) costs.


Project Management:


	Lead and manage engineering projects from feasibility to commissioning, including both &quot;Brownfield&quot; (existing) and &quot;Greenfield&quot; (new) sites.
	Provide technical support and guidance to the on-site engineering teams.


Leadership &amp; Management:


	Develop and implement departmental goals and strategies.
	Lead and mentor a competent maintenance team.
	Ensure strict safety compliance across all sites.
	Collaborate with the procurement team to establish annual maintenance contracts, negotiate terms, and develop alternative or local vendors.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-09-01",
  "validThrough": "2025-10-02",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

  },

Engineering Manager Job at Olam Agri




        
    

        
        Olam Agri is a market-leading, differentiated food, feed, and fiber agri-business with a global origination footprint, processing capabilities, and deep understanding of market needs built over 33 years. With a strong presence in high-growth emerging markets and products across grains & oilseeds, animal feed & protein, rice, edible oils, specialty grains & seeds, cotton, wood products, rubber and commodity financial services.

Olam Agri is at the heart of global food and agri-trade flows with more than 40 million MT in volume traded annually. Focused on transforming food, feed and fiber for a more sustainable future, it aims at creating value for customers, enabling farming communities to prosper sustainably, and strive for a food-secure future.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Engineering Manager

Job Location: Ilorin, Kwara
Employment Type: Full Time

Job Description


	The Engineering Manager is responsible for overseeing all engineering activities and maintenance practices across the company's sites.
	The primary goal is to ensure maximum plant availability and operational efficiency.


Responsibilities
Maintenance & Operations:


	Implement and manage best-in-class preventive and predictive maintenance strategies to maximize equipment uptime and plant availability.
	Set and achieve key performance indicator (KPI) targets, including power, steam, and Repair & Maintenance (R&M) costs.


Project Management:


	Lead and manage engineering projects from feasibility to commissioning, including both "Brownfield" (existing) and "Greenfield" (new) sites.
	Provide technical support and guidance to the on-site engineering teams.


Leadership & Management:


	Develop and implement departmental goals and strategies.
	Lead and mentor a competent maintenance team.
	Ensure strict safety compliance across all sites.
	Collaborate with the procurement team to establish annual maintenance contracts, negotiate terms, and develop alternative or local vendors.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Account Officer",
  "description": "LEAM Consulting is the foremost consulting firm which stands out in areas of professional certification training, HR advisory services, Business Development/Startup and IT consulting services in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Akobo, Ibadan - Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Brief


	We are looking for an accountant who will handle the day to day financial operations of the supermarket


Responsibilities


	Manage Accounts Receivables and branch imprest.
	Day-to-day management of the Financial and Management Accounting processes.
	Ensure all creditors&rsquo; balances are diligently &amp; completely recorded and accounted for on a daily basis.
	Monitoring &amp; tracking of inventory to correlate with inflow and outflow of stocks
	Analyze business operations, trends, costs, revenues, financial commitments, and obligations, to project future revenues and expenses or to provide advice.
	Establish tables of accounts, and assign entries to proper accounts.


Qualifications


	HND / B.Sc. in Finance, Accounting or any other related field.
	Minimum of 2 - 3 years of experience in a similar role.
	Experience in retail and supermarket chain is an added advantage
	Excellent Analytical skills: Very proficient in the use of Microsoft Excel and Retail Software.
	Excellent communication and presentation skills


Salary
N90,000 per month.&nbsp;

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;jobs@leamconsulting.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2025-09-16",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

  },

Account Officer Job at LEAM Consulting




        
    

        
        LEAM Consulting is the foremost consulting firm which stands out in areas of professional certification training, HR advisory services, Business Development/Startup and IT consulting services in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account Officer

Job Location: Akobo, Ibadan - Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Brief


	We are looking for an accountant who will handle the day to day financial operations of the supermarket


Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Manage Accounts Receivables and branch imprest.
	Day-to-day management of the Financial and Management Accounting processes.
	Ensure all creditors’ balances are diligently & completely recorded and accounted for on a daily basis.
	Monitoring & tracking of inventory to correlate with inflow and outflow of stocks
	Analyze business operations, trends, costs, revenues, financial commitments, and obligations, to project future revenues and expenses or to provide advice.
	Establish tables of accounts, and assign entries to proper accounts.


Qualifications


	HND / B.Sc. in Finance, Accounting or any other related field.
	Minimum of 2 - 3 years of experience in a similar role.
	Experience in retail and supermarket chain is an added advantage
	Excellent Analytical skills: Very proficient in the use of Microsoft Excel and Retail Software.
	Excellent communication and presentation skills


Salary
N90,000 per month. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobs@leamconsulting.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Job Position: Front Desk Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements


	Minimum of B.Sc. degree
	2 - 3 years of prior administrative experience
	Computer savvy and proficient with MS Office tools
	Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
	Discipline and ability to work with minimal supervision
	Must be ready to resume immediately.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to:&nbsp;laboriahr@gmail.com&nbsp;using &ldquo;Front Desk Officer &ndash; Abuja&rdquo; as the subject of the mail.",

Front Desk Officer Job at Laboria Limited




        
    

        
        Laboria Limited, a biomedical solutions provider, is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front Desk Officer

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements
     

            
    




	Minimum of B.Sc. degree
	2 - 3 years of prior administrative experience
	Computer savvy and proficient with MS Office tools
	Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
	Discipline and ability to work with minimal supervision
	Must be ready to resume immediately.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to: laboriahr@gmail.com using “Front Desk Officer – Abuja” as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": ".NET developer",
  "description": "Odixcity Consulting is an International Hr consulting and procurement firm. With expertise in Recruitment &amp; Selection, Performance management, Training &amp; Development, Compensation and benefits as well as Outsourcing of goods and services for organizations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: .NET developer
Job Location:&nbsp;Nigeria (Remote)

Responsibilities


	Write and test software applications using Microsoft .NET framework.
	Collaborate with other developers and stakeholders to gather requirements and design solutions.
	Debug and troubleshoot software issues to ensure applications are functioning properly.
	Create and maintain technical documentation such as architecture diagrams and test plans.
	Employ best practices for code efficiency, security, and software quality.
	Stay up to date with new technologies and advancements in the .NET framework.
	Participate in code reviews and contribute to ongoing improvement of software development processes.
	Implement software enhancements and new features based on user feedback.
	Use agile methodologies to manage tasks and collaborate with team members.
	Conduct performance testing and optimize software performance to ensure scalability and reliability.


Requirements


	A Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology or a related field.
	Proven experience as a .NET Developer orApplication Developer.
	Familiarity with the ASP.NET framework, SQL Server and design/architectural patterns e.g. Model-View-Controller.
	Knowledge of.NET languages e.g.; C#, Visual Basic .NET and HTML5/CSS3.
	Familiarity with architecture styles and APIs, REST, RPC.
	Understanding of Agile methodologies.
	Excellent troubleshooting and communication skills.
	Attention to detail.


Salary
N500,000&nbsp;monthly&nbsp;(non-negotiable).

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates send their CV and link to their portfolio to:&nbsp;jobscandidate8@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2025-09-01",
  "validThrough": "2025-10-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Odixcity Consulting"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Abuja, Enugu, Lagos, Rivers (PH)",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "186687"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 400000,
      "maxValue": 600000,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



.NET developer Job at Odixcity Consulting




        
    

        
        Odixcity Consulting is an International Hr consulting and procurement firm. With expertise in Recruitment & Selection, Performance management, Training & Development, Compensation and benefits as well as Outsourcing of goods and services for organizations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: .NET developer
Job Location: Nigeria (Remote)

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Write and test software applications using Microsoft .NET framework.
	Collaborate with other developers and stakeholders to gather requirements and design solutions.
	Debug and troubleshoot software issues to ensure applications are functioning properly.
	Create and maintain technical documentation such as architecture diagrams and test plans.
	Employ best practices for code efficiency, security, and software quality.
	Stay up to date with new technologies and advancements in the .NET framework.
	Participate in code reviews and contribute to ongoing improvement of software development processes.
	Implement software enhancements and new features based on user feedback.
	Use agile methodologies to manage tasks and collaborate with team members.
	Conduct performance testing and optimize software performance to ensure scalability and reliability.


Requirements


	A Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology or a related field.
	Proven experience as a .NET Developer orApplication Developer.
	Familiarity with the ASP.NET framework, SQL Server and design/architectural patterns e.g. Model-View-Controller.
	Knowledge of.NET languages e.g.; C#, Visual Basic .NET and HTML5/CSS3.
	Familiarity with architecture styles and APIs, REST, RPC.
	Understanding of Agile methodologies.
	Excellent troubleshooting and communication skills.
	Attention to detail.


Salary
N500,000 monthly (non-negotiable).

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates send their CV and link to their portfolio to: jobscandidate8@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply
